FuncDef:
The protected-vlan reference-instance command configures a Smart Link protection instance.
The undo protected-vlan reference-instance command deletes a Smart Link protection instance. The protected-vlan reference-instance command configures a Smart Link protection instance. The undo protected-vlan reference-instance command deletes a Smart Link protection instance. By default, all instances are Smart Link protection instances. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the first ID of a Smart Link load-balancing instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 48.

Specifies the last ID of a Smart Link load-balancing instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 48.
<endInst> must be greater than <beginInst>. <beginInst> and instance-id1 specify an instance ID range. If you do not specify to <endInst>, only one load-balancing instance with the ID <beginInst> is specified.
In one load-balance instance command, a maximum of 10 instance ID ranges can be specified using to.

Deletes all Smart Link load-balancing instance IDs.
-

ExtraInfo: After a protection instance is bound to a Smart Link group, Smart Link takes effect only on packets from VLANs mapped to the protection instance. If you want packets from some VLANs to be forwarded without being influenced by Smart Link, run the protected-vlan reference-instance command to configure protection instances to which only the other VLANs are mapped.
